contextId.information: "married women." This is an idiom for marrying women. They did not take women who were already married. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"they walked along the road." To walk down a road is an expression for walking away. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"to your husbands, who died." Naomi was referring to her two sons that died. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This means that they cried out loud or wept bitterly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: lifted up their voices and cried

contextId.information: This refers to Ruth asking God to punish her if she does not do what she said like the english idiom "God forbid, if". (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: May Yahweh punish me, and even more, if

contextId.information: This was a kind way of addressing a younger woman. Ruth was not the actual daughter of Boaz, so make sure the translation of this does not make it sound like she was. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to asking for a blessing. AT: "Let me receive grace from you" or "Please accept me"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Let me find favor in your sight

contextId.information: This refers to the eatable part of the grain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to leaving the city and heading to the threshing area. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: go down to the threshing floor

contextId.information: He looked to see what startled him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This was a cultural idiom for marriage. AT: "Marry me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: Spread your cloak over your female servant

contextId.information: "Seven" was the Hebrew number of completeness. Naomi's sons both died before they produced any offspring, but Ruth bore a grandson to Naomi by Boaz. AT: "better to you than any son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: better to you than seven sons
